15#include <openssl/bytestring.h>
16
17#include <assert.h>
18#include <string.h>
19
20#include "internal.h"
21#include "../internal.h"
22
23
24// kMaxDepth is a just a sanity limit. The code should be such that the length
25// of the input being processes always decreases. None the less, a very large
26// input could otherwise cause the stack to overflow.
27static const unsigned kMaxDepth = 2048;
28
29// is_string_type returns one if |tag| is a string type and zero otherwise. It
30// ignores the constructed bit.
31static int is_string_type(unsigned tag) {
32 switch (tag & ~CBS_ASN1_CONSTRUCTED) {
33 case CBS_ASN1_BITSTRING:
34 case CBS_ASN1_OCTETSTRING:
35 case CBS_ASN1_UTF8STRING:
36 case CBS_ASN1_NUMERICSTRING:
37 case CBS_ASN1_PRINTABLESTRING:
38 case CBS_ASN1_T61STRING:
39 case CBS_ASN1_VIDEOTEXSTRING:
40 case CBS_ASN1_IA5STRING:
41 case CBS_ASN1_GRAPHICSTRING:
42 case CBS_ASN1_VISIBLESTRING:
43 case CBS_ASN1_GENERALSTRING:
44 case CBS_ASN1_UNIVERSALSTRING:
45 case CBS_ASN1_BMPSTRING:
46 return 1;
47 default:
48 return 0;
49 }
50}
51
52// cbs_find_ber walks an ASN.1 structure in |orig_in| and sets |*ber_found|
53// depending on whether an indefinite length element or constructed string was
54// found. The value of |orig_in| is not changed. It returns one on success (i.e.
55// |*ber_found| was set) and zero on error.
56static int cbs_find_ber(const CBS *orig_in, int *ber_found, unsigned depth) {
57 CBS in;
58
59 if (depth > kMaxDepth) {
60 return 0;
61 }
62
63 CBS_init(&in, CBS_data(orig_in), CBS_len(orig_in));
64 *ber_found = 0;
65
66 while (CBS_len(&in) > 0) {
67 CBS contents;
68 unsigned tag;
69 size_t header_len;
70
71 if (!CBS_get_any_ber_asn1_element(&in, &contents, &tag, &header_len,
72 ber_found)) {
73 return 0;
74 }
75 if (*ber_found) {
76 return 1;
77 }
78 if (tag & CBS_ASN1_CONSTRUCTED) {
79 if (is_string_type(tag)) {
80 // Constructed strings are only legal in BER and require conversion.
81 *ber_found = 1;
82 return 1;
83 }
84 if (!CBS_skip(&contents, header_len) ||
85 !cbs_find_ber(&contents, ber_found, depth + 1)) {
86 return 0;
87 }
88 }
89 }
90
91 return 1;
92}
93
94// is_eoc returns true if |header_len| and |contents|, as returned by
95// |CBS_get_any_ber_asn1_element|, indicate an "end of contents" (EOC) value.
96static char is_eoc(size_t header_len, CBS *contents) {
97 return header_len == 2 && CBS_len(contents) == 2 &&
98 OPENSSL_memcmp(CBS_data(contents), "\x00\x00", 2) == 0;
99}
100
101// cbs_convert_ber reads BER data from |in| and writes DER data to |out|. If
102// |string_tag| is non-zero, then all elements must match |string_tag| up to the
103// constructed bit and primitive element bodies are written to |out| without
104// element headers. This is used when concatenating the fragments of a
105// constructed string. If |looking_for_eoc| is set then any EOC elements found
106// will cause the function to return after consuming it. It returns one on
107// success and zero on error.
108static int cbs_convert_ber(CBS *in, CBB *out, unsigned string_tag,
109 char looking_for_eoc, unsigned depth) {
110 assert(!(string_tag & CBS_ASN1_CONSTRUCTED));
111
112 if (depth > kMaxDepth) {
113 return 0;
114 }
115
116 while (CBS_len(in) > 0) {
117 CBS contents;
118 unsigned tag, child_string_tag = string_tag;
119 size_t header_len;
120 int ber_found;
121 CBB *out_contents, out_contents_storage;
122
123 if (!CBS_get_any_ber_asn1_element(in, &contents, &tag, &header_len,
124 &ber_found)) {
125 return 0;
126 }
127
128 if (is_eoc(header_len, &contents)) {
129 return looking_for_eoc;
130 }
131
132 if (string_tag != 0) {
133 // This is part of a constructed string. All elements must match
134 // |string_tag| up to the constructed bit and get appended to |out|
135 // without a child element.
136 if ((tag & ~CBS_ASN1_CONSTRUCTED) != string_tag) {
137 return 0;
138 }
139 out_contents = out;
140 } else {
141 unsigned out_tag = tag;
142 if ((tag & CBS_ASN1_CONSTRUCTED) && is_string_type(tag)) {
143 // If a constructed string, clear the constructed bit and inform
144 // children to concatenate bodies.
145 out_tag &= ~CBS_ASN1_CONSTRUCTED;
146 child_string_tag = out_tag;
147 }
148 if (!CBB_add_asn1(out, &out_contents_storage, out_tag)) {
149 return 0;
150 }
151 out_contents = &out_contents_storage;
152 }
153
154 if (CBS_len(&contents) == header_len && header_len > 0 &&
155 CBS_data(&contents)[header_len - 1] == 0x80) {
156 // This is an indefinite length element.
157 if (!cbs_convert_ber(in, out_contents, child_string_tag,
158 1 /* looking for eoc */, depth + 1) ||
159 !CBB_flush(out)) {
160 return 0;
161 }
162 continue;
163 }
164
165 if (!CBS_skip(&contents, header_len)) {
166 return 0;
167 }
168
169 if (tag & CBS_ASN1_CONSTRUCTED) {
170 // Recurse into children.
171 if (!cbs_convert_ber(&contents, out_contents, child_string_tag,
172 0 /* not looking for eoc */, depth + 1)) {
173 return 0;
174 }
175 } else {
176 // Copy primitive contents as-is.
177 if (!CBB_add_bytes(out_contents, CBS_data(&contents),
178 CBS_len(&contents))) {
179 return 0;
180 }
181 }
182
183 if (!CBB_flush(out)) {
184 return 0;
185 }
186 }
187
188 return looking_for_eoc == 0;
189}
190
191int CBS_asn1_ber_to_der(CBS *in, CBS *out, uint8_t **out_storage) {
192 CBB cbb;
193
194 // First, do a quick walk to find any indefinite-length elements. Most of the
195 // time we hope that there aren't any and thus we can quickly return.
196 int conversion_needed;
197 if (!cbs_find_ber(in, &conversion_needed, 0)) {
198 return 0;
199 }
200
201 if (!conversion_needed) {
202 if (!CBS_get_any_asn1_element(in, out, NULL, NULL)) {
203 return 0;
204 }
205 *out_storage = NULL;
206 return 1;
207 }
208
209 size_t len;
210 if (!CBB_init(&cbb, CBS_len(in)) ||
211 !cbs_convert_ber(in, &cbb, 0, 0, 0) ||
212 !CBB_finish(&cbb, out_storage, &len)) {
213 CBB_cleanup(&cbb);
214 return 0;
215 }
216
217 CBS_init(out, *out_storage, len);
218 return 1;
219}
220
221int CBS_get_asn1_implicit_string(CBS *in, CBS *out, uint8_t **out_storage,
222 unsigned outer_tag, unsigned inner_tag) {
223 assert(!(outer_tag & CBS_ASN1_CONSTRUCTED));
224 assert(!(inner_tag & CBS_ASN1_CONSTRUCTED));
225 assert(is_string_type(inner_tag));
226
227 if (CBS_peek_asn1_tag(in, outer_tag)) {
228 // Normal implicitly-tagged string.
229 *out_storage = NULL;
230 return CBS_get_asn1(in, out, outer_tag);
231 }
232
233 // Otherwise, try to parse an implicitly-tagged constructed string.
234 // |CBS_asn1_ber_to_der| is assumed to have run, so only allow one level deep
235 // of nesting.
236 CBB result;
237 CBS child;
238 if (!CBB_init(&result, CBS_len(in)) ||
239 !CBS_get_asn1(in, &child, outer_tag | CBS_ASN1_CONSTRUCTED)) {
240 goto err;
241 }
242
243 while (CBS_len(&child) > 0) {
244 CBS chunk;
245 if (!CBS_get_asn1(&child, &chunk, inner_tag) ||
246 !CBB_add_bytes(&result, CBS_data(&chunk), CBS_len(&chunk))) {
247 goto err;
248 }
249 }
250
251 uint8_t *data;
252 size_t len;
253 if (!CBB_finish(&result, &data, &len)) {
254 goto err;
255 }
256
257 CBS_init(out, data, len);
258 *out_storage = data;
259 return 1;
260
261err:
262 CBB_cleanup(&result);
263 return 0;
264}
